page.title: 06VILLAGE OF CASTLE EATON
page.content: A{Wiltshire}village of about 70 houses alongside four roads forming a narrow oblong with outlying farms both arable and dairy. There is a Post Office/General Store, an inn ("the Red Lion"), and a church. The housing consists of slate roofed, stone cottages (mostly modernised), infilled with post 1950 reconstituted stone, tiled houses plus large houses and four old people's bungalows. The only red-brick building are the inn, a private dwelling and some farm stables. The small village hall is made of corrugated iron. The school is closed but there is a small macadam play area with swings etc. The{River {Thames}flows parallel to the line of the village. 50% commute to work; 8% are retired. The main local work is farming.
